DataElement.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance Biological Absorption Description java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic substance including endogenous body substance used to diagnose, prevent, maintain, treat or analyze abnormal and normal biological functions in vivo or in vitro._The process of penetration of a substance into a living organism. This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). The common ways of absorption in mammals include organs of respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, and skin.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic substance including endogenous body substance used to diagnose, prevent, maintain, treat or analyze abnormal and normal biological functions in vivo or in vitro.

Concepts.definition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of penetration of a substance into a living organism. This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). The common ways of absorption in mammals include organs of respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, and skin.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

Concepts.definition: The process of penetration of a substance into a living organism. This process could involve specialized and/or non-specialized mechanisms, active transport or passive movement, and carrier system(s). The common routes of absorption in mammals include the organs of the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, and the skin.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
